abstracts.cdata!:
The project development objective, as
            stated in the Development Credit Agreement, was to improve
            road access to the Port of Djibouti by rehabilitating the
            road and associated service infrastructure from the port to
            the Djibouti-Ethiopian border. The project objective
            remained unchanged during implementation. However, following
            the decision of the European Union to finance the long-term
            rehabilitation of the South Corridor (rather than the
            initially planned North Corridor), a supplemental credit was
            approved by IDA in May 2003 to enable more extensive and
            sustainable rehabilitation and maintenance works on the road
            between Djibouti and Galafi. Principal performance rating
            are as follows ; outcome was satisfactory; sustainability
            was likely; institutional development impact was modest;
            Bank and borrower performance was satisfactory. The report
            cites the following as lessons learned: 1) need of simple
            design in emergency operation. 2) In emergency operations,
            substantial training activities and intensive supervision
            efforts are required to build capacity and support for PIUs
            during initial stages of the project. 3) Difficulty in
            achieving institutional reforms in emergency operations. 4)
            The experience of this project confirms that in addition to
            general delays in project execution, the construction and
            supervision cost of force accounts are likely to be much
            higher that those of the private contractors. Finally, the
            project shows the importance of flexibility and timely
            responsiveness to changes in circumstances and client's
            needs. During implementation the Bank reacted well and took
            all actions necessary to secure achievement of the project
            objective despite the changed situation.
